title: Malaysia Cracks Down on $1.1B Illegal Bitcoin Mining Power Theft
description: Illegal Bitcoin mining in Malaysia has stolen over $1.1 billion in electricity since 2020, straining the grid and raising costs for consumers. Authorities use drones and sensors to raid 14,000 sites, combating organized theft amid global crypto energy challenges. This highlights the need for sustainable mining practices worldwide.

title: Is bitcoin really digital gold? In 2025, the leading crypto has failed to answer that question
description: Bitcoin's big drop from a record price has led to questions about crypto's correlation to the broader market, and what it really represents in a portfolio.

title: Eric Jackson: Crypto Bear Market Prime for Bitcoin, Ethereum Investors
description: Hedge fund manager Eric Jackson views the current crypto bear market as a prime opportunity for long-term investors in Bitcoin and Ethereum, citing technological advancements, institutional inflows, and AI integration. Despite criticisms from short-sellers highlighting risks, optimistic forecasts predict significant price rebounds by 2025. His stance encourages focusing on fundamentals amid volatility.

title: Bitcoin $150K or $250K by 2026? Why Analysts Are Split on BTC’s Next Bull Cycle Pea
description: Bitcoin (CRYPTO: BTC) price predictions remain contentious, but the run-up to 2026 has inspired wild forecasts. After hitting a record high of $126,000 in October and then plunging nearly 30% through late November, BTC is now trading around $93,000.   Investors are watching two key catalysts: the next halving and spot Bitcoin ETF inflows. title: Harvard Triples Bitcoin Holdings to $443M While Retail Investors Panic Sell
description: Harvard University nearly tripled its Bitcoin (CRYPTO: BTC) holdings this year, buying $443 million worth during one of crypto’s worst selloffs. While retail investors panicked and sold, Harvard bought. The timing shows a strategy. Harvard accumulated between July and September while Bitcoin crashed, traders got liquidated, and fear hit levels not seen since FTX collapsed ... Harvard Triples Bitcoin Holdings to $443M While Retail Investors Panic SellThe post Harvard Triples Bitcoin Holdings to $443M While Retail Investors Panic Sell appeared first on 24/7 Wall St..

title: Central Bank Digital Currencies – Analysis
description: By Rebecca M. NelsonPolicymakers have debated whether the Federal Reserve (Fed) should create a central bank digital currency (CBDC)—a "digital dollar." A CBDC would share some of the features of cryptocurrencies (crypto)—that is, private digital currencies, such as Bitcoin, which are unsupported by any government authority. This In Focus describes how foreign central banks, the Administration, Congress, and the Fed are approaching the issue and discusses policy issues. For more detail, see CRS Report R46850, Central Bank Digital Currencies: Policy Issues.BackgroundContrary to some of...

title: Bitcoin rises to two-week high even as crypto market remains on shaky ground
description: Bitcoin climbs as much as 2.5% to about $93,900, its highest intraday level since November 17

title: Bitcoin’s Sky-High Prices Have Not Panned Out
description: Bitcoin has plunged more than 30 percent and Ether is down around 40 percent in recent months, as gains from President Trump’s pro-crypto policies evaporated.

title: Disruptive Theme of the Week: Stablecoin
description: On October 10, 2025, the crypto markets experienced a “flash crash” that caused bitcoin to erase this year’s gains and drop 30% from its peak. A series of events triggered that plunge: a surprise announcement of a 100% tariff on China, an abundance of leverage in the crypto markets, and the depeg of Binance’s USDe’s [...]The post Disruptive Theme of the Week: Stablecoin appeared first on ETF Trends.

title: Global law enforcement actions put pressure on cybercrime networks
description: In 2025, law enforcement agencies disrupted the infrastructure and operations of established cybercriminal groups. These groups shift across borders, and the agencies pursuing them are adjusting to that. International operations target cybercrime rings worldwide US investigators carried out one of the biggest seizures to date. They took about $15 billion in Bitcoin tied to Prince Group, accused of running forced-labor scam centers and various crypto fraud schemes. These operations target the fraud networks and also … More →The post Global law enforcement actions put pressure on...

title: Why Bitcoin ETFs Like IBIT May Be Set to Surge in 2026
description: As Bitcoin looks to find its bottom after its recent correction, spot ETFs that track the crypto are increasingly presenting buying opportunities.

title: Wipeout: Eric Trump’s crypto firm loses half its value in 30 minutes

title: Asia markets set to open higher after Wall Street declines on crypto sell-off
description: Overnight, bitcoin plunged around 6% to trade below $86,000, marking its worst day since March and pressuring the broader stock market down.

title: Bitcoin could outperform NASDAQ, gold in rebound rally
description: Bitcoin may well outperform both the NASDAQ and gold over the coming weeks, if we see a recovery rally in risk assets following the recent correction, according to Nigel Green, CEO of financial advisory group deVere Group. Cryptocurrencies slumped sharply on Monday, with Bitcoin falling as much as 6% and Ether tumbling more than 7%, extending a weeks-long selloff that began in early October when around $19 bln of leveraged crypto positions were wiped out. The benchmark cryptocurrency has now fallen roughly 30% from its October 7 peak near $124,000 to around $87,000, a far steeper adjustment...

title: BitMine Is Not Like Strategy, but Its Stock Still Isn’t a Buy
description: BitMine Immersion Technologies (NYSEAMEX:BMNR) has carved out a niche in the crypto treasury space by emulating Strategy (NASDAQ:MSTR), the pioneer in holding digital assets as corporate reserves. While Strategy loaded up on Bitcoin (CRYPTO:BTC), BitMine focused on Ethereum (CRYPTO:ETH), building a portfolio that now exceeds 3% of the total ETH supply — about 3.73 million ... title: Southeast Asia grows wary of crypto mining
description: As illegal crypto mining and scams proliferate across Southeast Asia, governments are discovering that "cheap" power for bitcoin can mean billion-dollar losses, strained power grids and rising climate costs.

title: Bitcoin : quand la crypto met l’Afrique face à un dilemme énergétique
description: Les avantages potentiels en termes de revenus et d’infrastructure numérique du boom du minage de bitcoin sont rapidement compromis par les demandes des mineurs pour une électricité à prix bas.
